arm_group.description: Junctional tourniquet use followed by rest, repeat

brief_summary.textblock:
The present research application is a new study involving normal human adult volunteers who
      will be used to investigate the performance of medical devices intended to stop junctional
      bleeding on the battlefield. Junctional wounds of interest are of the groin and the
      surrogate of bleeding is distal pulse absence temporarily during brief mechanical
      compression by devices at or near the groin. Data of differential device performance can
      generate knowledge of effectiveness rates ranked by device (models of devices), which may
      help in selecting prehospital devices for military and civilian trauma care.

clinical_study.brief_title: Performance of Junctional Tourniquets in Normal Human Volunteers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adult human volunteers who are recruited, screened, and consent to participate

          -  Ages at least 18 years old to no more than 60 years old (<61) on the date of consent

          -  Male or female

          -  A worker for the US Military or US Government (active duty military, civilian
             employees, contractors)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Active-duty military subjects without their supervisor's permission to participate

          -  Detainees or prisoners

          -  Evidence of major disease of an artery (e.g., artery or vein surgery, atherosclerotic
             disease diagnosis, stroke, peripheral vascular disease or dysfunction such as
             Reynaud's phenomenon, migraine headaches, or cardiovascular disease [uncontrolled
             hypertension, heart attack, or arrhythmias]), active abdominal, inguinal, gluteal, or
             thigh disease, major deformity, or hernias

          -  Pregnancy

          -  Contracted employees to the US Military or US Government without contractual
             permission to participate in the research
